choices.D: A forecast can be either revenue-based or quantity-based.
choices.B: Opportunity Split data cannot be viewed in a forecast.
choices.C: The default forecast categories cannot be customized.
choices.A: A single org can have up to six different types of forecasts.

questions.question_text:
DreamHouse Realty wants better insights into potential revenue in the next quarter and is considering using Collaborative Forecasts.

What should the administrator consider when setting up Collaborative Forecasts?

discussion.content:
D. A forecast can be either revenue-based or quantity-based.

When setting up Collaborative Forecasts, the administrator should consider that a forecast can be either revenue-based or quantity-based. This means that the administrator should determine what type of forecast is best suited for DreamHouse Realty based on its business needs. It's important to note that the default forecast categories can be customized, and opportunity split data can be viewed in a forecast. Additionally, a single org can have up to five different types of forecasts, including quota, revenue, quantity, custom, and territory.

choices.B: Import Wizard is only available for the standard objects Accounts, Contacts, and Leads.
choices.A: The Campaign Member option is only available for Update.
choices.C: The Marketing User feature license assignment is missing on the admin’s user record.
choices.D: The Salesforce.Id field is required and was missing from the file.

questions.question_text:
A request was made to import a spreadsheet of new Campaign Members. The system administrator started Data Import Wizard but the Campaign Members object was unavailable as a choice.

What is causing this to occur?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
No Campaign members in Import Wizard when user's field 'Marketing user' isn't check

questions.question_text: Which three password options are available for the administrator to set on content deliveries? (Choose three.)

choices.D: Password protection is optional and defaults to ON
choices.E: Password protection is optional and defaults to OFF

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
C,D,E is correct: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.content_delivery_about.htm&type=5

A, C, and E are the three password options available for the administrator to set on content deliveries.

A. Administrator-provided default password: The administrator can set a default password that will be used for all content deliveries, or can set a different password for each delivery.

C. Password protection is required: The administrator can require that a password be set for all content deliveries.

E. Password protection is optional and defaults to OFF: The administrator can choose not to require a password for content deliveries, and this option is turned off by default.

B and D are not correct password options for content deliveries.

Selected Answer: CDE
Answer is C, D, E

Selected Answer: CDE
C,D,E is correct

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants to change the current master-detail relationship between Shipments and Opportunities to a lookup relationship. The system administrator has made the necessary changes in a full sandbox and has successfully tested them against NTO’s data.

Now that the changes are ready to implement in production, what should the system administrator do next?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The answer is A

choices.C: Use Data Loader to export the changes to the production org.
choices.A: Add the components to an outbound change set and deploy it to production.
choices.D: Make the changes directly in the production org.
choices.B: Create an Unmanaged Package to distribute to production.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Should be D

choices.A: Advise the user to mark the duplicate opportunity Closed Lost and keep it in the system.
choices.B: Run a report of all opportunities to identify other possible duplicates.
choices.C: Change the user's profile to System Administrator so they have full permissions to delete object records.
choices.D: Check the user profile permissions on the Opportunity object to see if they have permission to delete.
